titleStmt.title: Gorden C. Coburn et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11054

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Ky
Carter County Sct
To His Excellency B. Magoffin Governor

the under signed petitioners would represent to your Excellency that Alfred McGloan was fined the sum of $10,00 in the Carter circuit Court for a breach of the peace Now we think his case kneeds your clemency and we petition your Excellency to remit said fine for these reasons (to wit) Mr McGloan is a good citizen with a Large family to support and we the think he is in Labouring circumstances and we are in formed that the whole matter was done by being aggrevated to make the Breach Now for pray for his relief we shall ever pray

Gorden C Coburn
Joseph C
Robert E McGlone
Jesse Samnis
AARon Loope
John N McGlone
Jams W McAllister
T. J. Smith
W. Mcormack
Harrison L Williams
Daniel. H. Underwood
S. P. Ratcliff
J. J. H. Gamble
Sanders Burress
G W Worten
Amos Daniel
John Burton
G. W. Medders
Alexander Kitchen
Joseph McGlone
James Jordan
Enoch Stone
MurPhy Kitchon
Lee J Yats
George Mcglone
Elijah Sorten
I H. McGlone
Vincent Furguson
thomas Smith
Nathan Simmons
Ephraim A Simmons
Thomas S McCley
James E Bush
